meanings.definition: To change repeatedly one's attitude or opinions with respect to a cause, subject, etc.
meanings.sent1: She would often tergiversate on her stance regarding the new policy.
meanings.sent2: Politicians sometimes tergiversate to gain more support from different groups.
meanings.sent3: The student tried to tergiversate when asked why he didn't do his homework.
meanings.sent4: His tergiversating between two political parties was likened to a pendulum swinging back and forth.
meanings.sent5: The constant tergiversation of the weather made planning the outdoor event challenging.

meanings.definition: To use evasions or ambiguities; equivocate.
meanings.sent1: When caught red-handed, he would often tergiversate instead of admitting the truth.
meanings.sent2: Some people tergiversate when they are uncomfortable with a direct question.
meanings.sent3: The suspect's tergiversation during the interrogation raised suspicions.
meanings.sent4: Her speech was filled with tergiversations, making it hard to understand her true intentions.
meanings.sent5: The CEO's tergiversating responses to the shareholders led to further distrust in the company.
